intro: Stylogyne nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as along stream banks and in humid forests. Stylogyne nicaraguensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
